meanings.def: used as the subject or object of a verb or after a preposition to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to
examples: You said you knew the way.
Can I sit next to you?
I want both of you to help.
I don't think that hairstyle is you (= it doesn't suit your appearance or personality).

meanings.def: used with nouns and adjectives to speak to somebody directly
used for referring to people in general
examples: You learn a language better if you visit the country where it is spoken.
It's a friendly place—people come up to you in the street and start talking.

meanings.def: you, your family and your close friends
examples: I wish you and yours all the best for the year ahead!

idioms.def: you, your family and your close friends
examples: I wish you and yours all the best for the year ahead!

related: Pussy Cat, Pussy Cat, Where Have You Been?
